Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the worst we have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Natty S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 days before the cruise and then for one more day after the cruise. First two days were good – we paid by the credit card for the room (it was rather clean), the breakfast was served to the room (fruit, 2 jogurts, one little cup of flakes (maybe enough for one person, not for two), biscuits, 2 croissants, cappuccino (or coffee, tea by your choice) and juice. But the last morning of our staying, before our departure, they refused to serve us the breakfast without any explanations (the only words we heard: “No breakfast”. As far as we understand, 3 nights – 3 breakfasts, but we had 3 nights and 2 breakfasts. So we had to find the place to have a snack though we had already paid for it. After such an attitude we’ll certainly never come to this place again, but we had one more booked night after the cruise. We got to the hotel, and the first problem was that they refused to accept the credit card because it was Friday (we do not understand what Friday has to do with credit cards). The next problem – we paid in cash – hotel price and extra taxes, but they did not give us any cheque! One more problem was the room – we have booked double, but got triple room with some problems – the flush system in WC did not work correctly. Besides, the upper light was so bad that it was twilight in the room – we returned from the town late in the evening, hoped to pack our things but failed – eyes got tired, it was really dark in the room, they obviously save on electric light bulbs. The next morning, as one would expect, we had no breakfast – and again no explanations. In our opinion the only advantage of this so-called hotel is its location – one can easily get to all sights in old town. This hotel was the worst we have ever stayed at, and unfortunately, it spoiled our impression about Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KenKratz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on two different occasions, for several nights. The rooms were clean and functional. The staff was excellent. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: toronto1951
Reviews.Content: 1. Very close to the Termini train station and bus station. Small sign on the street and no street address on street so a bit difficult to find 2. Easy walking distance to lots of sights 3. Tiny modern elevator to the 5th floor reception and rooms 4. Clean, simple rooms and modern clean washroom 5. Had room #38 which I would recommend as it has a very small walk out to a balcony that overlooks an ugly lane but is quiet at night 6. Air conditioning (extra 5 Euro charge) was necessary as the weather was hot and humid 7. Very nice breakfast (for Italy) which included cappiccino, croissants, yoghurt, fruit, juice, cereal) and was delivered to the room at your preferred time 8. Shower was very low-flow 9. Bed was comfortable 10. Sufficient cupboard space for short stay 11. There was a safe in the room 12. Staff were friendly and helpful. Overall I would highly recommend the place but it may depend on the room. I will be back 2 more times in the next 30 days so I may find out.

Reviews.Title: “Small and clean 'hotel' and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: trustmeyoudingdongs
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel is family run and only has 8 rooms. There's only a small sign pasted on the wall, so it's a little difficult to spot especially if you're arriving by car. Just look for Hotel Assisi, which is just next door! After lugging my heavy luggage up/down the stairs in Venice, we totally appreciated the lift in this building. Otherwise we would've cried from lugging it up 5 floors. We arrived at midnight. The door bells were a little confusing though. There were 2 of them, one alongside the rest of the buttons for the other apartments in the building, and the other on a separate "hotel dell'urbe' box. So when the owner finally responded on the telecom, she only spoke Italian! Which would've been a mighty pickle, if not for our cab driver who helped explain that we wanted to check in. They were pretty pissed that we rung the bell many times and risked waking up the rest of the guests. I called in the morning to inform them though, guess the message was not passed along. Anyhow, all this tension was quickly diffused and another english speaking lady came to help with our check in. And by golly the rooms were CLEAN. I loved that there was no icky carpets but squeaky clean tiles in the room. There was free high speed wifi and we were brought a tasty continental breakfast every morning. Location wise, this hotel was located just across the street from Stazione Termini. Hence it has great connections to airport buses, trains and local buses, and a supermarket! It might get a little noisy at night but you can only hear it if the air conditioning is not switched on.

Reviews.Title: “We like it”
Reviews.Author: irma_u
Reviews.Content: neat and clean. Breakfast super. We recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mariahui12
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Dell'Urbe! Rooms are clean, staff very friendly and trusting. Loved the location, we found it to be very safe and clean! On our last day, the credit card payment machine failed to operate. Because of the mechanical breakdown the owner suggested he would take care of the problem. To our surprise he personally escorted us to train station so that we would not miss our flight!. WOW! Excellent customer service! Thank you so much for our stayed, great recommendation to anyone travelling to Roma! Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Cash only, not friendly.”
Reviews.Author: WindwardHonolulu
Reviews.Content: We don't recommend this hotel. Our MAIN problem was when we got there they wouldn't accept a credit card although their website said nothing about a 'cash only' policy. We reserved the room with a credit card. Giving them cash, of course, meant the room was more expensive than originally thought. If your waist size is more than 34" you wouldn't be able to sit on the toilet! It was clean enough. Very small. The hotel is on the 5th floor, but has a lift which will fit two small people and their small luggage at once. No english spoken. Not too friendly when a problem is posed (we wanted to pay with a card as planned.) Very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed reservation - what a joke”
Reviews.Author: Janneki
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Venere.com and got a confirmed reservation. When we arrived there about 00:30 PM, after tryings we were able to woke up the owner. She vanished for a while and came back with the information - NO BOOKING FOR YOU. We had a confirmation paper with us, but that didn't help at all, because according to the owner hotel was fully booked. With a help we eventually got a room from neighborhood, but this reservation process was ridiculous. Hotel owner blamed venere.com and venere.com blamed the hotel when we contacted them after our trip. Don't know who caused the flaw, but I don't recommend using neither this hotel nor venere.com. Their explanation on this was so shocking bad having them all around their company (whatever).

Reviews.Title: “small and cold”
Reviews.Author: contractors
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Termini station, convenient for taking the train, metro and bus to anywhere in Rome. The room was small but clean and the bathroom was the tiniest we have seen so far. The main problem is that we stayed in winter and the heat is turned off every night from 1 am to 7 am. Since we only spent the night at the hotel after a long day's sightseeing, trying to sleep in a freezing room was bad. The second night the owner assured us that he would not turn off the heat but it went off just the same. An extra thin blanket did not help either. The owner stays next door and his wife delivers the morning breakfast to the room which was quite disappointing - coffee, juice, packaged toast and a crossaint. They don't speak much English and are not too helpful. The owner insisted on a Euro20 key deposit on checkin and we had to pay up the previous day, then checkout in the morning leaving our keys in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation for price”
Reviews.Author: TiarePrincess
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a short visit to Rome. This place was comfortable and the staff, although they could not speak good English, were friendly and helpful. The room was small, but airy and clean. It is not close to any sights so we either caught the bus or walked around Rome. It is located within walking distance to Stazione Termini, which was good. For the price we paid we found this accommodation fair and reasonable.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dell'Urbe
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Mille 27/A, 185 Rome, Italy
